de.upb.t2t.control.gui.transcriber

Class MainTranscriptionPane

  • java.lang.Object
    • javafx.scene.Node
      • javafx.scene.Parent
        • javafx.scene.layout.Region
          • javafx.scene.layout.Pane
            • javafx.scene.layout.BorderPane
              • de.upb.t2t.control.gui.transcriber.MainTranscriptionPane
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    UserFeedbackProvider, javafx.css.Styleable, javafx.event.EventTarget

    public class MainTranscriptionPane
extends javafx.scene.layout.BorderPane
implements UserFeedbackProvider
    The root Node of the primary's stages Scene. This pane is most central to the application, as it features a TextArea into which the user types whatever word or sentence they wish to have transcribed, as well as the FlowPane to whom all TranscriptionSegments will be added as soon as the transcription has started. On its top side, the main Menu while a ToolBar at the bottom provides the user with feedback about the status of their transcription.
    Author:
    Michel May (michel-may@gmx.de)
    See Also:
    Transcriber, TranscriptionSegment

    • Method Detail

      • generalFeedback

        public void generalFeedback(FeedbackMode mode,
                            java.lang.String feedback)
        Displays the given feedback string in the infoBarLabel. Should the first parameter equal FeedbackMode.LOADING, the infoBarProgress will be set to indeterminate mode. Otherwise, it will simply be hidden.
        Specified by:
        generalFeedback in interface UserFeedbackProvider
        Parameters:
        mode - the FeedbackMode to set.
        feedback - the message to show to the user.

      • progressFeedback

        public void progressFeedback(double progress,
                             java.lang.String feedback)
        Sets the infoBarProgress to the first parameter and displays the given feedback string in infoBarLabel.
        Specified by:
        progressFeedback in interface UserFeedbackProvider
        Parameters:
        progress - the progress level to set the ProgressBar to. Should meet the requirements of ProgressIndicator.setProgress(double).
        feedback - the message to show to the user.
